alert.note: Alert for Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Mitchell and southern Scurry Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snyder, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Dunn, Winston Field and Hermleigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
